page.title: 06Education_Wishford Area.
page.content: The only school in the area is situated in West Street,Great Wishford,opposite the Church of St.Giles. It is a first school and accepts children from five to nine years old.The school is Church of England aided,and is part of the Wilton and West Salisbury Comprehensive System.At the age of nine children transfer to Wilton Middle School and from there to Westwood St.Thomas School in Salisbury when they are thirteen years old. Gt.Wishford School was officially opened in 1722 and was endowed by Sir Richard Grobham Howe. In 1961 the school building was modernised and extended,a playground and large playing field were added.The new school was officially opened by the Bishop of Sherbourne in 1962.
